and perform the multiplication.

question: A 12
sols_html:
We proceed as in the hint. Let

\(D = \begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \\ e & f \end{bmatrix}\)

Then we have

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} = DB &= \begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \\ e & f \end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & -1 \\ -3 & 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\\ &= \begin{bmatrix} (a)(1) + (b)(-3) & (a)(0)+(b)(1) & (a)(-1) + (b)(0)\\ (c)(1) + (d)(-3) & (c)(0)+(d)(1) & (c)(-1) + (d)(0)\\ (e)(1) + (f)(-3) & (e)(0)+(f)(1) & (e)(-1) + (f)(0) \end{bmatrix}\\ &= \begin{bmatrix} a-3b & b & -a\\ c-3d & d & -c \\ e-3f & f & -e \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

Looking at the first row on the matrices on the left and right gives

\[\begin{aligned} a - 3b &= 1\\ b &= 0 \\ -a &= 0 \end{aligned}\]

and this is inconsistent since the last two imply that both a and b are zero and this contradicts the first line. Thus no such matrix D exists.
statement_html:
Let

\[\begin{aligned} A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 3 & 8 \end{bmatrix} \qquad B = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & -1 \\ -3 & 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

Calculate the following whenever defined. Otherwise state undefined and include a brief explanation.

A matrix \(D\) such that \(DB = I_{3}\) where \(I_{3}\) is the \(3 \times 3\) identity matrix.
